title: Of Consecration of Bishops and Ministers
text: The Book of Ordination contains the form and manner of consecration of Bishops, Priests, and Deacons ... and that the rites and ceremonies used in the consecration be observed as far as God's Word doth allow.
commentary: Article 36, “Of Consecration of Bishops and Ministers”, states: The Book of Ordination contains the form and manner of consecration of Bishops, Priests, and Deacons . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
